  • Constructor Details

    • DoaVector

      public DoaVector()
      Constructor. Creates a DoaVector with displacement in x and y as 0.

    • DoaVector

      public DoaVector​(float x, float y)
      Constructor. Creates a DoaVector with displacement in x and y with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - the displacement in x
      y - the displacement in y

    • DoaVector

      public DoaVector​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaVector other)
      Copy Constructor. Creates a DoaVector with displacement in x and y same as given parameter.
      Parameters:
      other - the DoaVector to copy

    • translate

      public static DoaVector translate​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaVector vector, float dx, float dy)
      Translates the vector in the x direction by dx and in the y direction by dy and returns the resulting vector. This function always creates a new vector.
      Parameters:
      vector - the vector translate
      dx - the change in x
      dy - the change in y
      Returns:
      the resulting vector

    • translate

      public static void translate​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaVector vector, float dx, float dy, @NotNull @NotNull DoaVector result)
      Translates the vector in the x direction by dx and in the y direction by dy and writes the resulting vector into result. vector + (dx, dy) = result
      Parameters:
      vector - the vector translate
      dx - the change in x
      dy - the change in y
      result - the resulting vector

    • negate

      public static void negate​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaVector vector, @NotNull @NotNull DoaVector result)
      Negates(inverses) the vector and writes the resulting vector into result. vector * (-1, -1) = result
      Parameters:
      vector - the vector to negate
      result - the resulting vector

    • normalise

      public static void normalise​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaVector vector, @NotNull @NotNull DoaVector result)
      Normalises the vector and writes the resulting vector into result. vector / ||vector|| = result
      Parameters:
      vector - the vector to normalise
      result - the resulting vector

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object obj)
      Compares this DoaVector to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a DoaVector object that represents the same amount of displacement as this DoaVector.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to compare this DoaVector against
      Returns:
      true if the given object represents a DoaVector equivalent to this DoaVector, false otherwise
